title: How to Make a Telephone Voice in Audacity

steps.headline: Record yourself saying something.
steps.description: Maybe say something like “Fall back team! Evacuate now!” at a project rate of 5000 HZ. Set your project rate first and click the Record button.

steps.headline: Change the project rate back to your default rate.
steps.description: Click the drop-down arrow list and choose your default rate.

steps.headline: Increase the volume a lot using Effect>Amplify.
steps.description: Don’t go too overboard with this or you might make it incoherent. Allow clipping. Clipping is the point.

steps.headline: Decrease the volume to a suitable amount.
steps.description: Sometimes you don’t have to do this.

steps.headline: Go to effect>high pass filter and follow the preferences set on the image below.
You’re almost done now.
steps.description: Repeat steps the increasing and decreasing of volume as needed, and now you have your “telephone voice”.

steps.headline: Now that you have your “telephone voice” feel free to use it in your films, machinimas, or radio-plays.

tyn: A microphone or a sound clip of you talking
text: Record yourself saying something. Maybe say something like “Fall back team! Evacuate now!” at a project rate of 5000 HZ. Set your project rate first and click the Record button. Change the project rate back to your default rate. Click the drop-down arrow list and choose your default rate. Increase the volume a lot using Effect>Amplify. Don’t go too overboard with this or you might make it incoherent. Allow clipping. Clipping is the point. Decrease the volume to a suitable amount. Sometimes you don’t have to do this. Go to effect>high pass filter and follow the preferences set on the image below.  You’re almost done now. Repeat steps the increasing and decreasing of volume as needed, and now you have your “telephone voice”. Now that you have your “telephone voice” feel free to use it in your films, machinimas, or radio-plays.
sentences: Maybe say something like “Fall back team!
Evacuate now!” at a project rate of 5000 HZ.
Set your project rate first and click the Record button.
Change the project rate back to your default rate.
Click the drop-down arrow list and choose your default rate.
Increase the volume a lot using Effect>Amplify.
Don’t go too overboard with this or you might make it incoherent.
Decrease the volume to a suitable amount.
Sometimes you don’t have to do this.
Go to effect>high pass filter and follow the preferences set on the image below.
Repeat steps the increasing and decreasing of volume as needed, and now you have your “telephone voice”.
Now that you have your “telephone voice” feel free to use it in your films, machinimas, or radio-plays.
